summary: This document is an email chain from October 2020 discussing the forensic examination and transfer of hard drives (HDs) related to the Epstein case. It involves coordination between FBI forensic examiners and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) to ensure evidence is accessible for review.

persons.name: Frank
persons.role: FBI Senior Forensic Examiner / NY CART Coordinator
persons.context: He is the primary point of contact for the forensic examination of Epstein-related hard drives, coordinating their availability, access, and shipment to SDNY.

persons.name: Steve
persons.role: FBI Supervisory Special Agent (SSA) - Forensic Examiner
persons.context: He is overseeing the forensic examination process and is copied on updates regarding the Epstein hard drives.

connections.description: They are both FBI forensic examiners coordinating on the Epstein evidence examination, with Steve being supervisory.
They are FBI colleagues coordinating the logistics and review of Epstein forensic evidence.
The FBI is coordinating with the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to provide access to and review of Epstein evidence.

events.title: Initial coordination on Epstein hard drives
events.description: Email discussion begins regarding the forensic examination and transfer of Epstein-related hard drives between FBI and SDNY.

events.title: Forensic examination update and shipment coordination
events.description: Frank provides an update that most forensic exports are complete and hard drives can be shipped to SDNY, and mentions retrieving information from evidence in storage in the Bronx.

events.title: Request to ensure SDNY access
events.description: A forwarded email emphasizes ensuring SDNY is aware of and can access the Epstein forensic evidence, asking who to contact at SDNY.

keyFacts: Epstein-related hard drives and media had been available in the FBI's CAIR forensic system for over a year as of October 2020.
Forensic exports for all but 6 machines were completed and ready for shipment to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY).
The case was receiving high-level attention ('Given the attention this case is getting from EM'), prompting efforts to avoid delays in evidence review.
Evidence was stored in a facility in the Bronx, from which information was being retrieved.
The email chain shows active inter-agency coordination between the FBI and SDNY prosecutors regarding evidence access well after Epstein's death.
